sentence.text: Her son reacted even more strongly -- he was downright rude . "
` I 've forgotten your name ; how rude of me . "
How rude of me , I should have offered you some tea or coffee . "
This was so overtly rude that Edouard was about to intervene ; but before he could speak , Grégoire rose to his feet .
Isobel stared : it was so unlike him ; she could n't think why he was being so rude .
She went on , ` Mother used to say it was so rude to keep people waiting , because it implied that you thought your time was more precious than theirs . "
Did he have to be so deliberately rude ?
So it 's rude language .
Kim : ` We 've never all gone out in hats at the same time -- we 'd get far too many rude comments . "
` All I can say is I hope you were n't too rude to that insurance investigator then , " Mark put in drily .
And he wo n't dare be too rude to you because you 're not a peasant .
It seemed very rude to remind his Company Commander about his own orders .
` If you can excuse my very rude daughter , I 'll be grateful to you , " Edward said .
As I was much smaller than him , he was very rude to me and behaved very badly , especially when nobody was looking .
In conversation , he could be very rude about his colleagues .
I was very rude and tactless with your grandmother .
One thing led to another and Luke made a rude gesture with his finger .
Some people may find rude jokes funny but others may be deeply offended .
The threat was enough to stop Rita and Bob going as far as their friends with real rude words .
The technique was developed to keep rude words off radio phone-ins .
` God and death , " Anna said , marshalling jars , ` two of the rudest words in the world . "
` It 's rude to ask a lady her age , is n't it ? "
` Would it be rude of me to ask who he was hiding it from ? "
` It was inexcusably rude of us to argue in front of you . "
It was rude to stare , she knew that much .
` Daddy always said it was rude to swear like that , " one of the twins informed her , giving her pretty blonde aunt a wide , beaming grin .
` It 'd seem a bit rude to walk past without saying anything . "
They chattered and laughed , being rude about Western passersby who could not understand their language .
In private , politicians from other countries are becoming increasingly rude about Britain .
Well , one thing 's for sure -- if people are rude about her , she makes sure she gives as good as she gets .
As one manager expressed it : " If you want to move an elephant you have to be pretty rude about it . "
Was n't that a little rude of you ? "
And do n't be surprised if he 's rude to you .
She was rude to Larry Hagman , snubbed Joan Collins and poked fun at the skinny figure and revealing frocks favoured by Cher .
Jenny went on being provocatively rude to Matthew and loving to James .
The only way to reply to a rude challenge must be an affected brightness of spirit however drenched and uncomfortable one might feel .
Other angry motorists blew their horns and flashed rude two-finger salutes when they finally managed to overtake him .
Cranston made a rude noise with his lips .
In it , he argues that women are free to be as nasty , rude , insulting and vicious as they like about men , but the reverse is not true .
He shows it by being angry and rude all the time to everyone .
But I did n't want to be in the office making phone calls to people who 're rude and saying go away .
